summary: The bill, titled the "Making Any Reimbursement Against the Law for Guarding Overnight Act" or "MARALAGO Act," prohibits the U.S. Secret Service from using federal funds to pay a President, or any entity the President owns or controls, for expenses incurred while protecting the President at their residence.  It allows a President to gift lodging, meals, office space or other expenses to the Secret Service. The definition of President includes a former President.
